2.text: Think you this to be right, that you said, My righteousness is more than Godâ€™s?

3.text: For you said, What advantage will it be to you? and, What profit shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin?

4.text: I will answer you, and your companions with you.

5.text: Look to the heavens, and see; and behold the clouds which are higher than you.

6.text: If you sin, what do you against him? or if your transgressions be multiplied, what do you to him?

7.text: If you be righteous, what give you him? or what receives he of your hand?

8.text: Your wickedness may hurt a man as you are; and your righteousness may profit the son of man.

9.text: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make the oppressed to cry: they cry out by reason of the arm of the mighty.

10.text: But none said, Where is God my maker, who gives songs in the night;

11.text: Who teaches us more than the beasts of the earth, and makes us wiser than the fowls of heaven?

12.text: There they cry, but none gives answer, because of the pride of evil men.

13.text: Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.

14.text: Although you say you shall not see him, yet judgment is before him; therefore trust you in him.

15.text: But now, because it is not so, he has visited in his anger; yet he knows it not in great extremity:

16.text: Therefore does Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplies words without knowledge.
